result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J. Ragen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Travis J. Ragen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Travis J. Ragen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:34 AM Court calls 22CF18 and 19CF213 Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis J. Ragen in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Michael Melowski and Attorney Corey Mehlos in court for Travis J. Ragen. Rachel Race, VWC, present.  ADA advises victim rights complied with.  Court reviews Plea Agreement.  Restitution is stipulated to by Defense of $7,497.47.  PSI, Alternative PSI and Sentencing Memorandum, letters were filed and reviewed by the Court.  JC, victim's husband, makes Stmt..  WT, victim's sister-in-law, makes Stmt..  DE, victim's daughter, makes Stmt.  Defendant's Step-father, Scott Kamke  makes Stmt.  Defendant's Aunt Jill Charlier makes Stmt.  Defendant's Cousin Amber Johnson makes Stmt.  Defense questions Justin Rooney, Author of Alternate PSI, by phone.  State's recommendation for Sentencing.  Defense recommendation for Sentencing.  Stmt. by Deft.  Court sentence:  19CF219 - WI State Prison Forthwith TOTAL 15 years.  9 Years IC and 6 years ES.  Deft. is not eligible for CIP OR SAP.  Credit 297 days.  Conditions of ES-  8 years revocation of DL.  IID Installed on any owned, operated, or registered vehicle during the length of ES.  $7497.440 Restitution paid in full w/bond.  Fine of $2000+costs=3078.00 (less balance of bond) all payable to Clerk of Courts during IC.  Balance to be paid at the rate of $100/month beginning 60 days from release of IC.  In default of payment, referral to State Debt Collection.  Supervision fees as ordered and payable to DOC during probation. Submit DNA Sample.  Absolute Sobriety.  No alcohol not a drop. No bars or establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No alcohol on premises of home.  Prescription medications to be verified by agent.  Enroll into and successfully complete all treatment deemed appropriate by DOC.  No contact w/J.D.  22CF18 - 9 months Oconto County Jail consecutive to 19CF213.  Costs/DNA of $538.00 and DA Service fee $144.95payable to Clerk of Courts during IC.  Balance to be paid at the rate of $100/month beginning 60 days from release of IC.  In default of payment, referral to State Debt Collection.  Submit DNA Sample.

1:11  Court calls 19CF213, 22CF18, 21CF219  Defendant Travis J. Ragen in court, in custody. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Corey Mehlos in court for Travis J. Ragen. Plea agreement reviewed by court.  19CF213 Court reviews count 2 and Deft. enters a NO CONTEST plea. 22CF18 Court reviews count 5 and Deft. enters a NO CONTEST plea.  Plea quest. & waiver of rights reviewed. Voting/Firearms given. Atty. Melowski reads elements on the record.  Court finds plea made freely & voluntarily. Court accepts plea. Deft. is adjudged guilty on 19CF213 count 2 and 22CF18 count 5 and orders a JOC entered into the record. Bond revoked.  PSI Ordered.   21CF219 to be dismissed. 19CF213 Ct. 1 & 3 dismissed.  22CF18 balance of charges dismissed. Notice of Hearing given to Deft. in custody.   Defense to file sentencing memorandum.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:29 PM Court calls case 19CF213, 21CF219, 22CF18 Defendant Travis J. Ragen in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Defendant Travis J. Ragen in custody.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  19CF213- FPT on 5/9.  JT 5/24 to 5/27.  Court makes Stmt. as to Motion for Reconsideration as to use of blood draw.  State late in filing brief.  Defense now asks for more time or to strike response of State.  Court will not strike State's response.  Defense wants an additional 42 days.  Court orders that on May 24th the JT in 19CF213 will not proceed due to additonal time of brief response.  Jury Trial will proceed in both cases 21CF219 and 22CF18.  Defense given until June 1st to respond to brief in 19CF213.  FPT 5/9/22 and JT on 5-24 will proceed on cases 22CF18 and 21CF219.  A jury trial date will be scheduled in 19CF213 at closure of jury trial in 22CF18 and 21CF219.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:30 AM Court calls 19CF213, 21CF219, 22CF18.  Court Defendant Travis J. Ragen in court with attorney Corey Mehlos who appears by phone.  Defendant Travis J. Ragen in custody.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  22CF18 - Waives reading of Information and enters NOT GUILTY Plea.  21CF219 and 22CF18 scheduled for PTC.  19CF213 is set for FPT on 5/9/22 and JT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

($10,000 posted on 12/12/2019) Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety, shall not posses or consume alcohol, controlled substance without a valid Rx or drug paraphernalia. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/ J.D, B.G., D.E., and J.C. or their residences. Prior to release defendant must be on SCRAM bracelet and approved by the Court. Must be on house arrest if released.
Clerk asked Attorney Mehlos if he has been retained in the newest case in which he indicated he was. He will file a NOR to reflect.

03:03 PM  Defendant Travis J. Ragen in court, in custody, with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Investigator Troy Sherman who is sworn and testifies. Cross exam by Attorney Mehlos. Redirect by ADA Rowe. Witness excused. Evidence and testimony is closed. Attorney Mehlos objects to bind over. Court makes stmt. Based upon the testimony the Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant is bound over to the circuit court. ADA Rowe on bond conditions. Court amends bond conditions. Present bond cont'd.  Arraignment scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

to include 19CF213, 21CF219 and 22CF18 w/condition   Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/victims family D.E. and J.C.    Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.  Must have Scram Bracelet prior to release and approved by the court.  Must be on house arrest if released.

10:01 AM19CF213, 21CF219, 22CF18 Defendant Travis J. Ragen in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski (appearing only on 19CF213) and Corey Mehlos.  Defendant Travis J. Ragen in custody.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:01 19CF213  - Court recites that JT scheduled beginning 5/24 and FPT on 5/9.  Motion for Reconsideration of the Court's Finding argued by Atty. Melowski.  ADA to file brief by 3/1/22.  Defense to respond by 3/15/22.  Court to issue written decision with no further argument.  10:20 a.m. 22CF18-Defense waives reading of complaint and requests a PH and waives time limits.  Counsel argues bond.  Court cancels revocation of bond in 19CF213 and sets a $110,000 cash bond ($10,000 posted) on all three cases 19CF213, 21CF219, 22CF18 with same conditions w/an addition of prior to release must have Scram bracelet and approved by court.  Must be on house arrest if released.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 3 p.m.
